name: Xavier X Agent - Not Pulling In Agent Nodes

parameters.toolDescription: Call this tool to create a tweet

parameters.text:
=Describe this image. It's style (is it a cartoon, real life, anime, be clear). 

What is in this image as well, the details.

This is a tweet text the user also posted with the image i'm asking you to analyze here:

{{ $json["Tweet text"] }}

The tweet text may help or not help in identifying what the image is about.

Avoid saying "the image is", or "in this image", just give the description and thats it.

parameters.toolDescription: Call this tool to get Tweet data
Call this tool to reply to tweets

parameters.content:
# How to setup

## 1. Start by going to "Get Users" in the Scrape Top Tweets section. On the URL, at the end, change the keyword to whatever you want (your niche)

## 2. Then input your favourite RSS feeds into "Input RSS Feeds here" in the Get Trending Topics section (double check they work, run it, etc, to make sure its getting articles). Ideally you want 7-10 articles that pass the "IF" node, so add a few different RSS feeds and ensure they're also updated ones which post frequently. (You can ask your chat model to search for RSS feeds related to your niche)

## 3. Create the tables in Supabase, all the SQL's have been provided. Simply go to Supabase, click on "SQL Editor" and run them, one by one (the ones in purple boxes below)

## 4. Create a character for the "Character" table, the template has also been provided. Once you've finished the template, send it to your chat model with the prompt, then execute the SQL it gives you in Supabase

## 5. Connect your Gmail account for Reports

## 6. Add the Twitter AIO API keys, Tavily, ChatGPT, Claude

## 7. Connect your Supabase credentials

-- Characters table with auto-incrementing ID
CREATE TABLE public.characters (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    age VARCHAR(50),
    backstory TEXT,
    personality JSONB,
    passions JSONB,
    goals TEXT,
    behavior JSONB,
    tasks JSONB,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE public.scraped_tweets (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    followers VARCHAR(255),
    media_url_https TEXT,
    conversation_id VARCHAR(255),
    tweet_text TEXT,
    retweet_count VARCHAR(255),
    reply_count VARCHAR(255),
    quote_count VARCHAR(255),
    image_description TEXT,
    scraped_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- Tweets table with auto-incrementing ID
CREATE TABLE public.tweets (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    character_name VARCHAR(255),
    tweet_text TEXT,
    views_count VARCHAR(255),
    retweet_count VARCHAR(255),
    reply_count VARCHAR(255),
    favorite_count VARCHAR(255),
    bookmark_count VARCHAR(255),
    inserted_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

# Create your character

=== Create a New Character ===

Instructions:
1. Fill out the required details below about your character.
2. The Name field is where you set your character’s name—you don’t need to repeat it in the other fields.
3. Add any extra details you know (like interests, personality traits, behavior preferences, or tasks).
4. The more detail you provide, the better the chat model can complete the character and build a prompt!
5. Take this filled template to a chat model and ask it to:
   - Complete the missing details (e.g., personality, passions, behavior, tasks) in JSON format.
   - Generate an SQL INSERT statement for the 'characters' table.
6. Run the SQL in Supabase to add your character.

---

### Character template (Note: You can also generate characters just by giving this to your chat model directly if you don't want to fill it out yourself):

{
  "name": "<text, required>",
  "age": a number,
  "backstory": "<text, required - a brief history of the character>",
  "personality": {
    "tone": "<text - how they sound>",
    "style": "<text - their way of expressing themselves>",
    "traits": [
      "<trait1>",
      "<trait2>",
      "<trait3>"
    ]
  },
  "passions": {
    "fights": "<text - what they passionately argue or obsess over>",
    "openings": "<text - what they love starting with or exploring>",
    "collecting": "<text - what they collect>"
  },
  "goals": "<text, required - what they aim to achieve>",
  "behavior": {
    "reply_style": "<text - how they respond to others>",
    "avoid_topics": [
      "<topic1>",
      "<topic2>"
    ]
  },
  "tasks": {
    "post": "<text - what they post about>",
    "reply": "<text - how they engage in replies>"
  }
}
## Put your characters name in the Character List node
## Put your characters name in the Character List node

# Prompt to give your chat model

## Complete the character details for the 'characters' table and generate an SQL INSERT statement. The table has columns: id (integer, auto-incrementing), name (text, required), age (integer, required), backstory (text, required), personality (jsonb, required), passions (jsonb, required), goals (text, required), behavior (jsonb, required), tasks (jsonb, required), created_at (timestamp, auto-filled). The jsonb fields should be JSON objects, where personality includes 'tone' and 'style', passions includes 'fights', 'openings', and 'collecting', and behavior includes 'reply_style' and 'avoid_topics'.

## (Copy paste your character you created here and send the prompt + your character you created in your chat model of choice)
# Now with the SQL the chat model gives you, execute it in SQL editor

### Add Tavily API key in Header Auth. 

### 1. Name: Authorization
### 2. Key: Bearer your-api-key

# 1. Make sure to click "Test Workflow" here (on the node itself)

# 2. Then add your User ID into the "Get Replies Data" node below

# Your Twitter AIO API key, get it here:

## https://rapidapi.com/viperscores-viperscores-default/api/twitter-aio

## Add the API key in the header

### 1. Click "Genertic Credential Type"
### 2. Choose "Header Auth"
### 3. Name: x-rapidapi-key
### 4. Then place your API key below

# Disclaimer

## Be sensible with the characters you make. Think about the writing styles, etc. Think about who they are, whether fictional or yourself. Ensure it responds how you would like be testing your character before hand as well.
